title: Access the Meta-Analytic Psychotherapy Databases
text: package allows access Metapsy meta-analytic psychotherapy databases R. install metapsyData package, use following code: metapsyData package allows access Metapsy meta-analytic psychotherapy databases directly R environment. installed, simply use getData function insert database shorthand save data locally. search available databases metapsyData shorthands, run listData function. databases included metapsyData come extensive documentation entry docs.metapsy.org. Databases loaded R environment can directly analyzed using functions metapsyTools package.

title: Access the Meta-Analytic Psychotherapy Databases
code: # List all available databases listData()  # Get latest version of the 'inpatients' database d <- getData("depression-inpatients")  # Show variable description d$variableDescription()  # Open online documentation d$openDocumentation()  # Analyze using metapsyTools library(metapsyTools) runMetaAnalysis(d)

what: Import Metapsy databases into the R environment — getData
title: Import Metapsy databases into the R environment — getData
text: function allows download publicly available versions Metapsy databases R environment.

title: Import Metapsy databases into the R environment — getData
Import Metapsy databases into the R environment — getData
text: shorthand character. shorthand assigned database downloaded. Shorthands listed "Metadata" database documentation entry. Alternatively, available databases shortcodes can accessed running listData(). version character. version number downloaded. Default NULL, downloads latest version. include.metadata logical. set TRUE, function return R6::R6Class() object includes metadata associated database version. See "Value".

title: Import Metapsy databases into the R environment — getData
text: include.metadata set TRUE, getData function return requested dataset , well metadata associated within . Metadata items included default : database.doi: digital object identifier database ("Concept DOI" Zenodo API. DOI always resolve latest database version). documentation.url: URL database documentation entry Metapsy Documentation page. github.repo.url: URL specific Github repository state database released. last.search: Date last search. last.updated: Date last database updated (release). license: License database. repository.download.url: Link download entire database Zenodo. title: Title database (including version). variable.description: Description variables included dataset. version: Version database. version.doi: DOI associated specific version database. contrast database.doi, identifier also link specific database version. returned R6::R6Class() object also contains helpful functions, can called directly object: downloadZip(): download database (including metadata) .zip file Zenodo repository. openDocumentation(): opens database documentation entry Metapsy Documentation page. openGitRepo(): opens Github repository database state release. returnMetadata(): Returns entire metadata stored metapsyDatabase R6 object list. variableDescription(): prints variable description database R Console. include.metadata FALSE, function return dataset simple data.frame.

title: Import Metapsy databases into the R environment — getData
text: function can work without Zenodo API access token. token required, setting one provides several benefits: Higher rate limits: Authenticated requests can fetch 100 records per page, compared 25 records per page unauthenticated requests. significantly speeds data retrieval databases many versions. Reduced rate limiting: Authenticated requests less likely hit Zenodo's rate limits, especially fetching multiple pages results. Automatic pagination: function automatically handles pagination retrieve versions, faster token due larger page sizes. token set, function optionally prompt set one. can also set update token time using updateZenodoAccessToken(). create Zenodo API access token: Log Zenodo account. Visit page. Create new personal access token. Copy token use updateZenodoAccessToken() save . token saved .Renviron file permanent storage across R sessions. function automatically validates tokens clear invalid expired tokens.

title: Import Metapsy databases into the R environment — getData
text: Mathias Harrer m.harrer@vu.nl

title: Import Metapsy databases into the R environment — getData
code: if (FALSE) { # List all available databases listData()  # Get latest version of the 'depression-psyctr' database d <- getData("depression-psyctr")  # Get version 24.0.2 of the 'depression-psyctr' database d <- getData("depression-psyctr", "24.0.2")  # Show variable description d$variableDescription()  # Open online documentation d$openDocumentation()  # Analyze using metapsyTools library(metapsyTools) runMetaAnalysis(d) }

title: List all available databases — listData
text: function lists publicly available Metapsy databases. prints database shorthands, can used import data using getData().

title: List all available databases — listData
List all available databases — listData
text: Returns data.frame available databases shorthand, along URL database documentation entry.

title: List all available databases — listData
text: Mathias Harrer mathias.h.harrer@gmail.com

title: List all available databases — listData
code: if (FALSE) { # List all available databases listData()  # Get latest version of the 'depression-psyctr' database d <- getData("depression-psyctr")  # Get version 22.2.0 of the 'depression-inpatients' database d <- getData("depression-inpatients", "22.2.0")  # Show variable description d$variableDescription()  # Open online documentation d$openDocumentation()  # Analyze using metapsyTools library(metapsyTools) runMetaAnalysis(d, which.run = "combined") }

title: Open database documentation — openDocs
text: function opens online documentation imported database.

title: Open database documentation — openDocs
Open database documentation — openDocs
text: data database data.frame imported using getData().

title: Open database documentation — openDocs
text: Opens database documentation entry docs.metapsy.org.

title: Open database documentation — openDocs
text: Mathias Harrer mathias.h.harrer@gmail.com

title: Open database documentation — openDocs
code: if (FALSE) { # List all available databases listData()  # Get latest version of the 'depression-psyctr' database d <- getData("depression-psyctr")  # Get version 22.2 of the 'depression-psyctr' database d <- getData("depression-psyctr")  # Show variable description variableDescription(d)  # Open online documentation openDocs(d) }

what: Update Zenodo API Access Token — updateZenodoAccessToken
title: Update Zenodo API Access Token — updateZenodoAccessToken
text: function allows update set Zenodo API access token. token saved .Renviron file permanent storage also set current R session.

title: Update Zenodo API Access Token — updateZenodoAccessToken
Update Zenodo API Access Token — updateZenodoAccessToken
text: token character. Zenodo API access token. NULL (default), function interactively prompt enter token. can create token .

title: Update Zenodo API Access Token — updateZenodoAccessToken
text: Invisibly returns TRUE successful, FALSE otherwise.

title: Update Zenodo API Access Token — updateZenodoAccessToken
text: function performs following actions: token NULL, prompts enter token Strips quotes token accidentally included Saves token .Renviron file (located ~/.Renviron) Updates token current R session token already exists .Renviron, updated updating token, may need restart R/RStudio changes take full effect, though token available current session immediately.

title: Update Zenodo API Access Token — updateZenodoAccessToken
text: Mathias Harrer mathias.h.harrer@gmail.com

title: Update Zenodo API Access Token — updateZenodoAccessToken
code: if (FALSE) { # Update token interactively updateZenodoAccessToken()  # Update token directly updateZenodoAccessToken("your_token_here") }

title: Show variable description for Metapsy database — variableDescription
code: if (FALSE) { # List all available databases listData()  # Get latest version of the 'depression-psyctr' database d <- getData("depression-psyctr")  # Get version 22.2 of the 'depression-psyctr' database d <- getData("depression-psyctr")  # Show variable description variableDescription(d)  # Open online documentation openDocs(d) }
